commit_message:
Removes over zealous arp cache flushing

This commit removes the use of the net-cache flushing from all
$service plays which ensures that the cache is not overly flushed
which could impact performance of services like neutron.

The role lxc-container-destroy role was removed because its not used
and if it were ever used it its use would result in the same
situation covered by this issue.

Additionally it was noted that on container restarts, the mac addresses
of the container interfaces change.  If *no* flushing is done at all,
this results in long run times whilst the arp entry for the container IP
times out.  Hence, we add in here a configuration option that causes a
gratuitous arp whenever an interface has it's mac set, and/or the link
comes up.  Because of the way the container veths work, we can't rely
on that happening on a linkm up event. So we forcefully set the mac
address in the post-up hook for the interface to force the issue of the
gratuitous arp.

Co-Authored-By: Evan Callicoat <diopter@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darren Birkett <darren.birkett@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I96800b2390ffbacb8341e5538545a3c3a4308cf3
Closes-Bug: 1497433
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/67/225367/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: OpenStack LXC container destroy ############################### :tags: openstack, lxc, container, cloud, ansible :category: \*nix contributor guidelines ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Filing Bugs ----------- Bugs should be filed on Launchpad, not GitHub: "https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible" When submitting a bug, or working on a bug, please ensure the following criteria are met: * The description clearly states or describes the original problem or root cause of the problem. * Include historical information on how the problem was identified. * Any relevant logs are included. * The provided information should be totally self-contained. External access to web services/sites should not be needed. * Steps to reproduce the problem if possible. Submitting Code --------------- Changes to the project should be submitted for review via the Gerrit tool, following the workflow documented at: "http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#development-workflow" Pull requests submitted through GitHub will be ignored and closed without regard. Extra ----- Tags: If it's a bug that needs fixing in a branch in addition to Master, add a '\<release\>-backport-potential' tag (eg ``juno-backport-potential``). There are predefined tags that will autocomplete. Status: Please leave this alone, it should be New till someone triages the issue. Importance: Should only be touched if it is a Blocker/Gating issue. If it is, please set to High, and only use Critical if you have found a bug that can take down whole infrastructures. Style guide ----------- When creating tasks and other roles for use in Ansible please create then using the YAML dictionary format. Example YAML dictionary format: .. code-block:: yaml - name: The name of the tasks module_name: thing1: "some-stuff" thing2: "some-other-stuff" tags: - some-tag - some-other-tag Example **NOT** in YAML dictionary format: .. code-block:: yaml - name: The name of the tasks module_name: thing1="some-stuff" thing2="some-other-stuff" tags: - some-tag - some-other-tag Usage of the ">" and "|" operators should be limited to Ansible conditionals and command modules such as the ansible ``shell`` module. Issues ------ When submitting an issue, or working on an issue please ensure the following criteria are met: * The description clearly states or describes the original problem or root cause of the problem. * Include historical information on how the problem was identified. * Any relevant logs are included. * If the issue is a bug that needs fixing in a branch other than Master, add the ‘backport potential’ tag TO THE ISSUE (not the PR). * The provided information should be totally self-contained. External access to web services/sites should not be needed. * If the issue is needed for a hotfix release, add the 'expedite' label. * Steps to reproduce the problem if possible.

commit_message:
Added correct URL to edit QoS spec

Not able to edit the QoS spec since we are getting 'NoReverseMatch' exception.

The Exception thrown because the given URL is not correct.

This patch adding the correct URL to edit the QoS spec.

Change-Id: I0381ea343494be3449a8036b99fcbba98d893cb9
Closes-Bug: #1465185
(cherry picked from commit 5d34ba5a3c059ec9f6ef9735db68016b690fbf29)

commit_message:
Fix inability to switch region via Switch Region dropdown

Remove class 'hide' that prevented modal login form from showing.
Add "spinner" before page reload, after submit form.

Related commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130157/
Related-Bug: #1381413

(cherry picked from commit dbf5fe0a2005c546a2f89353fd217405335370f7)

Change-Id: Ib81fc148e1c2c70df2b41309ce83d80a3a28d038

commit_message:
Update the devstack readme.md for Octavia as ref

The readme.md in the devstack directory did not get updated
for Octavia being the reference driver.  This patch updates
the document to enable the Octavia plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1500656
Change-Id: I39f9f9d060512c9b3af9dd08c413931f9b94cf78
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/68/228668/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 1) Enable the plugins enable_plugin neutron-lbaas <neutron-lbaas GITURL> [GITREF] enable_plugin octavia <octavia GITURL> [GITREF] <neutron-lbaas GITURL> is the URL of a neutron-lbaas repository <octavia GITURL> is the URL of a octavia repository enable_plugin neutron-lbaas https://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas stable/liberty enable_plugin octavia https://github.com/openstack/octavia stable/liberty 2) Enable the LBaaS services To enable the LBaaS services, add lines in the form: ENABLED_SERVICES+=<OCTAVIA-FLAGS> <OCTAVIA-FLAGS> are "octavia" the Octavia driver, "o-cw" the Octavia Controller Worker, "o-hk" the Octavia housekeeping manager, "o-hm" the Octavia Health Manager, and "o-api" the Octavia API service. ENABLED_SERVICES+=,q-lbaasv2 ENABLED_SERVICES+=,octavia,o-cw,o-hk,o-hm,o-api
deleted_lines: 1) Enable the plugin enable_plugin neutron-lbaas <GITURL> [GITREF] <GITURL> is the URL of a neutron-lbaas repository enable_plugin neutron-lbaas https://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas stable/kilo 2) Enable the LBaaS service To enable the LBaaS service, add a line of the form: ENABLED_SERVICES+=q-lbaasv2

commit_message:
Service Engine versioning

This change allows the schema to contain engine version matching
for heat and murano so that the client can exclude assets for
incompatible engines.

Change-Id: I6afa2a12d1a8c842a41aebc6ee27db9739438986

commit_message:
Backend support for magnum service

To support 'magnum service-list' after 'nova service-list', we need to
introduce periodic status update functionality for internal services.

Change-Id: Ia0c09222405c87cb61e5de4a43ba345ae3405b50
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-service-list
Closes-bug: #1492501

subject: Add nova v20 jobs as experimental in Tempest gate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-09 06:21:34.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/a09f0dbcc268a4f6434d4b7240f5ac25a586001a', 'message': "Add nova v20 jobs as experimental in Tempest gate

With I86a627b8ec7b1246452a16c10dcfb1ad5f83bdef, all existing Tempest jobs
tests on nova /v2.1 by default and new jobs were introduced for
'v2.0 on v2.1' and 'v2.0 on legacy v2.0 code'

There might be case where Tempest tests modification can break v2.0 jobs
on Nova side. So it will be good if v2.0 jobs can be monitored on Tempest

This patch makes v2.0 jobs to run as experimental on Tempest gate testing.

Change-Id: I5bd4a2b8d699099a00ae0237e306aa9be97b105f
"}]
commit_message:
Add nova v20 jobs as experimental in Tempest gate

With I86a627b8ec7b1246452a16c10dcfb1ad5f83bdef, all existing Tempest jobs
tests on nova /v2.1 by default and new jobs were introduced for
'v2.0 on v2.1' and 'v2.0 on legacy v2.0 code'

There might be case where Tempest tests modification can break v2.0 jobs
on Nova side. So it will be good if v2.0 jobs can be monitored on Tempest
side changes also.

This patch makes v2.0 jobs to run as experimental on Tempest gate testing.

Change-Id: I5bd4a2b8d699099a00ae0237e306aa9be97b105f

commit_message:
Add `data` gulp task.

This adds a new Gulp task to automatically include `app/data` in
dev builds if it exists. This directory will contain sample data
files for use during development and outputs them to `build/data`.
Additionally, this integrates with browser-sync and will
automatically reload open browsers as testing datasets are
changed.

Change-Id: Ie1578682d11e36bd6142b9d326f50a547aa4613b

commit_message:
Clean outdated config files and boilerplate examples.

Various example resources from the project boilerplate can be
removed, and configuration files for bower and eslint are no
longer needed. An outdated Karma config file is also removed,
as JavaScript tests are moved into the `test` subdirectory.

Change-Id: I2407c20f00f3346b8969d819db92a9fb70c429eb

commit_message:
Part 1: Adding ACL support for Client API.

Added ACL client API support.
Added ACL client API specific unit tests.

Refactored client code as per meetup comments.
Modified client get call to return data which can be looked by
operation_type value.
Moved add and remove users calls to cli as for client side, client
will make updates directly in acl entity and submits changes to server.

Change-Id: Ieb6d6a60919e2fdc311df605a51e88b87baa3c67

commit_message:
Minor refactoring of openstack_dashboard.api.neutron

Move common logic among most neutron related resources
into the base class NeutronAPIDictWrapper.

Change-Id: I9148a5e0f4333709f155befddc7f45c62309acc7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/49/226949/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, apidict): if 'admin_state_up' in apidict: if apidict['admin_state_up']: apidict['admin_state'] = 'UP' else: apidict['admin_state'] = 'DOWN' # Django cannot handle a key name with ':', so use '__'. apidict.update({ key.replace(':', '__'): value for key, value in apidict.items() if ':' in key }) super(NeutronAPIDictWrapper, self).__init__(apidict) def __init__(self, apidict): apidict['ipver_str'] = get_ipver_str(apidict['ip_version']) super(Subnet, self).__init__(apidict) def __init__(self, apidict): if 'mac_learning_enabled' in apidict: apidict['mac_state'] = \ ON_STATE if apidict['mac_learning_enabled'] else OFF_STATE super(Port, self).__init__(apidict)
deleted_lines: def _init_apiresource(apiresource): """Handle common initialization of apiresource. Note: the dictionary is modified in place. """ if apiresource['admin_state_up']: apiresource['admin_state'] = 'UP' else: apiresource['admin_state'] = 'DOWN' # Django cannot handle a key name with ':', so use '__'. apiresource.update({ key.replace(':', '__'): value for key, value in apiresource.items() if ':' in key }) def __init__(self, apiresource): _init_apiresource(apiresource) super(Agent, self).__init__(apiresource) def __init__(self, apiresource): _init_apiresource(apiresource) super(Network, self).__init__(apiresource) def __init__(self, apiresource): apiresource['ipver_str'] = get_ipver_str(apiresource['ip_version']) super(Subnet, self).__init__(apiresource) def __init__(self, apiresource): _init_apiresource(apiresource) if 'mac_learning_enabled' in apiresource: apiresource['mac_state'] = \ ON_STATE if apiresource['mac_learning_enabled'] else OFF_STATE super(Port, self).__init__(apiresource) def __init__(self, apiresource): super(Profile, self).__init__(apiresource) def __init__(self, apiresource): _init_apiresource(apiresource) super(Router, self).__init__(apiresource)

subject: VPNaaS: Provide Endpoint groups capability.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-13 18:31:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/0e33f577ead9670cca3dacf7b3757d218a38343c', 'message': 'WIP: Only pushed to investigate UT failure...

Temp work to start an extension for VPN endpoints.

Created initial extension, and made stubs for each API method. Created a
new (partial) table for endpoint groups to be able to test it a bit.
Made migration files, so that it can be used to create database tables.

Have create working for just name and description. Including endpoint type
and new endpoints table with relationships. Able to create with subnets
and with vlans. Database tables are done (as are migration "expand" for
them).

Added CIDR type to handle peer IPSec endpoints. Checked creation.

Started adding API test (but it is failing).

Need to do the following (at least):

- Validation within a group of all being the same type
- Validation of endpoints in group match the type (CIDR for subnet)

- UTs for new API, database, and plugin methods

- Revise connection to use the new API via new attributes
    * service driver collects info and passes to device driver
    * device driver uses new info versus old
    * device driver uses multiple local endpoints (part of other commit)

- Implement show, list, update, and delete APIs

- Remove support for old subnet in vpnservice
- Remove peer-cidrs from connections

- Migration "contract" support for new tables and copy info over

- Neutron client (and Horizon changes too)

- Future: Use this for multiple local endpoints for IPSec.

Change-Id: I6e10590a988312eafca076a14be38b19e2d44a87
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-19 13:41:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/03c6472a6bd9bb5beac967d1ba8a700a22c8af94', 'message': 'Endpoint groups: Create API and database

This commit defines the needed tables for VPN endpoint-groups, and defines
the REST API for creation. Migration files created, so that the needed tables
are created. Unit tests have been added for the API and database.

Follow-on commits will create show, list, update, and delete APIs, will add
validation, and will add to migration so that existing VPN subnets and peer
CIDRs are populated into the tables.

Neutron client and Horizon support can be added later, and the IPSec APIs
updated to make use of the new endpoint groups.

Should this be done as an enhancement to the existing v2 API or done as a
v3 API (and if so, how do we signify that in the code)?

Change-Id: I6e10590a988312eafca076a14be38b19e2d44a87
Partial-Bug: 1459423
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-24 21:10:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/fbac237bccdebac1c230891ac4f1b5296173c4e3', 'message': 'Endpoint groups: Implements API and database

This commit implements the new tables for VPN endpoint-groups, and the
CRUD REST API. Migration files are created, so that the needed tables
are created. Unit tests have been added for the API and database.

The neutron client and Horizon support for this new API will be handled
separately, as will API test cases for the new API.

The multiple local subnet feature for IPSec tunnels, will use this new
API. Note: given that VPNaaS is not being used in production environments
(based on a poll of operators), the endpoint groups API will be added
under the existing v2 API extension and the resulting multiple local
subnet enhanced API will NOT be backward compatible.

Operators have been notified of this plan, and if unacceptable, then the
additional effort will be applied to support backward compatibility.

This is currently a WIP, the following remains to be done:
- UT for delete/show/list API
- Add validation logic
- Update API tests (separate commit, once API migrated)

Depends-On: Ia729bd0c6967fa2b8c698495aa360f340b42d98a
Change-Id: I6e10590a988312eafca076a14be38b19e2d44a87
Partial-Bug: 1459423
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-28 17:01:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/7b3546b5df3b4f6345d056ce4fbfd655076a733f', 'message': 'Endpoint groups: Implements API and database

This commit implements the new tables for VPN endpoint-groups, and the
CRUD REST API. Validation logic has been added for the reference
implementation. Migration files are created, so that the needed tables
are created. Unit tests have been added for the API and database.

The neutron client and Horizon support for this new API will be handled
separately, as will API test cases for the new API.

This new API is a prerequisite for providing the multiple local subnet
feature, which will use this API and make changes to existing APIs. At
that time, migration and backward compatibility support will be provided,
so that users can migrate smootly to the new API (since there is no
support for micro-versioning).

Depends-On: Ia729bd0c6967fa2b8c698495aa360f340b42d98a
Change-Id: I6e10590a988312eafca076a14be38b19e2d44a87

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-31 15:13:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/6ccd97416826d19c42cb32c68abcb0f6d340de44', 'message': 'Endpoint groups: Implements API and database

This commit implements the new tables for VPN endpoint-groups, and the
CRUD REST API. Validation logic has been added for the reference
implementation. Migration files are created, so that the needed tables
are created. Unit tests have been added for the API and database.

The neutron client and Horizon support for this new API will be handled
separately, as will API test cases for the new API.

This new API is a prerequisite for providing the multiple local subnet
feature, which will use this API and make changes to existing APIs. At
that time, migration and backward compatibility support will be provided,
so that users can migrate smootly to the new API (since there is no
support for micro-versioning).

Depends-On: Ia729bd0c6967fa2b8c698495aa360f340b42d98a
Change-Id: I6e10590a988312eafca076a14be38b19e2d44a87
Partial-Bug: 1459423

commit_message:
VPNaaS: Provide Endpoint groups capability.

This commit implements the new tables for VPN endpoint-groups, and the
CRUD REST API. Validation logic has been added for the reference
implementation. Migration files are created, so that the needed tables
are created. Unit tests have been added for the API and database.

The neutron client and Horizon support for this new API will be handled
separately, as will API test cases for the new API.

This new API is a prerequisite for providing the multiple local subnet
feature, which will use this API and make changes to existing APIs. At
that time, migration and backward compatibility support will be provided,
so that users can migrate smoothly to the new API (since there is no
support for micro-versioning).

APIImpact

Depends-On: Ia729bd0c6967fa2b8c698495aa360f340b42d98a
Change-Id: I6e10590a988312eafca076a14be38b19e2d44a87
Partial-Bug: 1459423
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/92/212692/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_vpnaas.extensions import vpnaas # TODO(pcm): Pull, once unused from neutron_vpnaas.extensions import vpnaas_v3class VPNEndpoints(model_base.BASEV2): """Endpoints used in VPN connections. An endpoint can be a VLAN, subnet CIDR, network (UUID?), router (UUID?), or BGP route target. """ __tablename__ = 'vpn_endpoints' endpoint = sa.Column(sa.String(255), nullable=False, primary_key=True) endpoint_group_id = sa.Column(sa.String(36), sa.ForeignKey('vpn_endpoint_groups.id', ondelete="CASCADE"), primary_key=True) class VPNEndpointGroup(model_base.BASEV2, models_v2.HasId, models_v2.HasTenant): """Collection of endpoints of a specific type, for VPN connections.""" __tablename__ = 'vpn_endpoint_groups' name = sa.Column(sa.String(255)) description = sa.Column(sa.String(255)) endpoint_type = sa.Column(sa.Enum("subnet", "cidr", "vlan", "network", "router", name="vpn_endpoint_type")) endpoints = orm.relationship(VPNEndpoints, backref='endpoint_group', lazy='joined', cascade='all, delete, delete-orphan') class VPNPluginDb(vpnaas_v3.VPNPluginBaseV3, base_db.CommonDbMixin): def _make_endpoint_group_dict(self, endpoint_group, fields=None): res = {'id': endpoint_group['id'], 'tenant_id': endpoint_group['tenant_id'], 'name': endpoint_group['name'], 'description': endpoint_group['description'], 'endpoint_type': endpoint_group['endpoint_type'], 'endpoints': []} return self._fields(res, fields) def create_endpoint_group(self, context, endpoint_group): LOG.info(_("PCM: create %r"), endpoint_group) group = endpoint_group['endpoint_group'] tenant_id = self._get_tenant_id_for_create(context, group) # TODO(pcm): validator = self._get_validator() with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): # TODO(pcm): validator.validate_endpoint_group(context, group) # Check that CIDRs valid, subnets exist. endpoint_group_db = VPNEndpointGroup( id=uuidutils.generate_uuid(), tenant_id=tenant_id, name=group['name'], description=group['description'], endpoint_type=group['endpoint_type']) context.session.add(endpoint_group_db) for endpoint in group['endpoints']: endpoint_db = VPNEndpoints( endpoint=endpoint, endpoint_group_id=endpoint_group_db['id'] ) context.session.add(endpoint_db) return self._make_endpoint_group_dict(endpoint_group_db) def update_endpoint_group(self, context, endpoint_group_id, endpoints): LOG.info(_("PCM: update %(group_id)s, %(endpoints)r") % {'group_id': endpoint_group_id, 'endpoints': endpoints}) def delete_endpoint_group(self, context, endpoint_group_id): LOG.info(_("PCM: delete %s"), endpoint_group_id) def get_endpoint_group(self, context, endpoint_group_id, fields=None): LOG.info(_("PCM: show %(group_id)s %(fields)r") % {'group_id': endpoint_group_id, 'fields': fields}) def get_endpoint_groups(self, context, filters=None, fields=None): LOG.info(_("PCM: list %(filters)r %(fields)r") % {'filters': filters, 'fields': fields}) return self._get_collection(context, VPNEndpointGroup, self._make_endpoint_group_dict, filters=filters, fields=fields)
deleted_lines: from neutron_vpnaas.extensions import vpnaasclass VPNPluginDb(vpnaas.VPNPluginBase, base_db.CommonDbMixin):

subject: Setup multinode interfaces on singlenode n-net
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-24 20:31:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/6c0bc3da23169e213079a17ddad2b32f9082536b', 'message': 'Setup multinode interfaces on singlenode n-net

Because nova net takes over eth0 by default and slurps it into br100
there are corner cases where this will break funny existing network
setups. One example is where the VMs default route is not within the
network assigned to eth0.

Work around this by using the overlay networking with nova net always.
We will create an ovs gre bridge that is a bridge to nowhere. But nova
net can connect to that and not break the existing networking.

Change-Id: Ia8af343b17e05191e47dc7f3969aeaf19a443da6

commit_message:
Setup multinode interfaces on singlenode n-net

Because nova net takes over eth0 by default and slurps it into br100
there are corner cases where this will break funny existing network
setups. One example is where the VMs default route is not within the
network assigned to eth0.

Work around this by using the overlay networking with nova net always.
We will create an ovs gre bridge that is a bridge to nowhere. But nova
net can connect to that and not break the existing networking.

Change-Id: Ia8af343b17e05191e47dc7f3969aeaf19a443da6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/42/227542/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PRIMARY_NODE=`cat /etc/nodepool/primary_node_private` SUB_NODES=`cat /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private` # We always setup multinode connectivity to work around an # issue with nova net configuring br100 to take over eth0 # by default. # TODO (clarkb): figure out how to make bridge setup sane with ansible. ovs_gre_bridge "br_pub" $PRIMARY_NODE "True" 1 \ $FLOATING_HOST_PREFIX $FLOATING_HOST_MASK \ $SUB_NODES ovs_gre_bridge "br_flat" $PRIMARY_NODE "False" 128 \ $SUB_NODES cat <<EOF >>"$localrc" FLAT_INTERFACE=br_flat PUBLIC_INTERFACE=br_pub EOF # We always setup multinode connectivity to work around an # issue with nova net configuring br100 to take over eth0 # by default. # TODO (clarkb): figure out how to make bridge setup sane with ansible. ovs_gre_bridge "br_pub" $PRIMARY_NODE "True" 1 \ $FLOATING_HOST_PREFIX $FLOATING_HOST_MASK \ $SUB_NODES ovs_gre_bridge "br_flat" $PRIMARY_NODE "False" 128 \ $SUB_NODES cat <<EOF >>"$localrc" FLAT_INTERFACE=br_flat PUBLIC_INTERFACE=br_pub EOF
deleted_lines: PRIMARY_NODE=`cat /etc/nodepool/primary_node_private` SUB_NODES=`cat /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private` # TODO (clarkb): figure out how to make bridge setup sane with ansible. ovs_gre_bridge "br_pub" $PRIMARY_NODE "True" 1 \ $FLOATING_HOST_PREFIX $FLOATING_HOST_MASK \ $SUB_NODES ovs_gre_bridge "br_flat" $PRIMARY_NODE "False" 128 \ $SUB_NODESFLAT_INTERFACE=br_flat PUBLIC_INTERFACE=br_pub

commit_message:
Fix UTF-8 handling in tables

Previous fix was not complete.

Altered the transform for sequence comparison to use str
instead of repr for greater py2/py3 compatibility in the
face of unicode.

Closes-Bug: #1488443
Related-Bug: #1464461
Co-Authored-By: Richard Jones <r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6b2c554350399f97f639e4c1e8d1ac8a34c9d046

commit_message:
Add ceilometer to plugin registry

Ceilometer is now removed from devstack and only exists as a plugin
so it should be in the registry.

Unfortunately the length of the URL changed the table formatting so
the diff is much larger than the semantic change.

Change-Id: Ibe8e27e97294c2d13be8f22f41eea27775811eec

commit_message:
Add reno for release notes

reno is a new tool for managing release notes using text files inside
the repository. We will need to add it to the test-requirements.txt file
so the sphinx integration can be used to publish release notes in the
development documentation builds.

Change-Id: Ibb2a08e9513123486ca58188ec097b7cd00c0d7f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/60/226560/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Removing os-token from devstack/lib/cue script

 Token variable thats been used from devstack has been renamed in
 one of the recent commits to devstack.So removing it so that it
 uses username/password for openstack and neutron commands instead.

Change-Id: Iec1328a51111b0f966acb9e8c523946c75a017b4

commit_message:
Generate openstackclient subcommands from setting identity API to v3

The current client reference manual contains openstackclient subcommands for
default versions of all project APIs. For identity API, the default is v2.
Which means subcommands related to "domain" and other identity v3 concepts are
not listed. This patch generates a separate section for the new openstack
subcommands obtained by using v3 identity API. Note that we list only the
diff in the new section rather than the complete subcommand list since
non-identity subcommands (e.g. neutron, glance, etc) will not vary by changing
identity API version.

An alternate solution might be to simply change identity API version to v3
instead of the current v2 and not bother about generating separate sections
for v2 and v3. I verified that v3 subcommands are not a strict superset of
v2 commands (we lose 2 subcommands). So, we need separate sections.

Change-Id: Ic3fc9ed5f3644497e4dd25a92ded01ee0224cdef
Co-Authored-By: Shashirekha Gundur <shashirekha.j.gundur@intel.com>
Closes-Bug: #1477935

('complete' or 'bash-completion') of subcommands to document :param extra_params: Extra parameter to pass to os_command. :param suffix: Extra suffix to add to xml:id :param title_suffix: Extra suffix for title """ print("Documenting '%s' subcommands..." % os_command) for subcommand in subcommands: document_subcommand(os_command, subcommand, os_file, extra_params,def document_subcommands(os_command, os_file, subcommands, extra_params, suffix, title_suffix): """Convert os_command help subcommands for all subcommands to DocBook. :param os_command: client command to document :param os_file: open filehandle for output of DocBook file :param subcommands: list or type ('complete' or 'bash-completion') of subcommands to document :param extra_params: Extra parameter to pass to os_command. :param suffix: Extra suffix to add to xml:id :param title_suffix: Extra suffix for title """ subcommands = generate_subcommands(os_command, subcommands, extra_params) output_subcommands(os_command, os_file, subcommands, extra_params, suffix, title_suffix) def output_end(os_file): output_heading(os_command, api_name, title, out_file) document_command(os_command, out_file) if os_command == 'glance': if os_command == 'murano': out_file.write(""" <section xml:id="murano_cli_v1"> <title>Application catalog API v1 commands</title>

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

As mentioned in the developer's guide[0] and in a discussion[1],
we shouldn't use six.iteritems() unless there's a good reason (eg
large data set).

Since there's no need to use six.iteritems() in the two places
where it is being used, this patch replaces them with items().

[0] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#peer-review
[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I8c659550d8e70c217b43a4e64b178f1a91d2be77

commit_message:
Imported Translations from Zanata

For more information about this automatic import see:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Translations/Infrastructure

Change-Id: I9f4d6558d5e515e0a28480ae76fef574b7efc015
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/39/228739/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

" "Wait until existing job is completed or is canceled" msgstr "" "別の ID %(job_id)s のジョブが、すでに %(target)s を設定するために作成されてい" "ます。既存のジョブが完了するか、取り消されるまで待ってください。" #, python-format msgid "Asynchronous exception for node %(node)s: %(msg)s exception: %(e)s" msgstr "ノード %(node)s の非同期例外: %(msg)s 例外: %(e)s" #, python-format msgid "Attribute %(attr)s cannot be set to value %(val)s. It must be in %(ok)r" msgstr "" "%(attr)s 属性は値を %(val)s に設定できません。%(ok)r にある必要があります。" msgid "" "Authentication method for iRMC operations; either 'basic' or 'digest'. The " "default value is 'basic'. Optional." msgstr "" "iRMC 操作の認証方式。「basic」または「digest」。デフォルト値は「basic」。オプ" "ション。" msgid "" "Authentication method to be used for iRMC operations, either "basic" or " ""digest"" msgstr "iRMC の操作に使用する認証方式。「basic」か「digest」のどちらか。" msgid "Available commands" msgstr "利用できるコマンド" msgid "" "Base url of the OCS chassis manager REST API, e.g.: http://10.0.0.1:8000. subject: Remove unnecessary 'context' param from quotas reserve method call
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-16 08:41:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e596851c7abc0dd700c6523fb884de05d44eea51', 'message': "Remove unnecessary 'context' param from quotas reserve method call

context' parameter was removed from quota-related method signatures in patch [1].
In patch [2] use of 'context' parameter was removed from quota-related method calls.

Still at some places 'context' parameter was passed to quota reserve method call.

Removed use of 'context' parameter from those places and passed 'context' as kwargs
while creating object of nova.objects.Quotas type.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164268/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/160499/

Change-Id: I20ea77bd20f093ce1be7169c0647cdc7ff62117c
Closes-Bug: 1494653
(cherry picked from commit 4031272fe93d1046cff4c0cc788c8e78db944419)
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-23 10:14:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9aeddc62a7a863f178f0a350432c528db1d13794', 'message': 'Remove unnecessary 'context' param from quotas reserve method call

(A) 'context' parameter was removed from quota-related method signatures in patch [1].
In patch [2] use of 'context' parameter was removed from quota-related method calls.

Still at some places 'context' parameter was passed to quota reserve method call.

Removed use of 'context' parameter from those places and passed 'context' as kwargs
while creating object of nova.objects.Quotas type.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164268/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/160499/

(B) On restart of nova-compute if there is instance with vm_state as
'DELETED' but that instance is not marked as deleted in database. In that case,
while calling _complete_partial_deletion method from _init_instance method
it raises " ValueError: Circular reference detected" error.

Removing 'context' parameter from quotas.reserve method call in
_complete_partial_deletion method addresses this issue as well.

Change-Id: I20ea77bd20f093ce1be7169c0647cdc7ff62117c
Closes-Bug: 1494653
(cherry picked from commit 4031272fe93d1046cff4c0cc788c8e78db944419)

In patch [2] use of 'context' parameter was removed from quota-related method calls.

Removed use of 'context' parameter from those places and passed 'context' as kwargs
while creating object of nova.objects.Quotas type.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164268/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/160499/

Backport notice:
On restart of nova-compute if there is instance with vm_state as
'DELETED' but that instance is not marked as deleted in database. In that case,
while calling _complete_partial_deletion method from _init_instance method
it raises " ValueError: Circular reference detected" error.

Removing 'context' parameter from quotas.reserve method call in
_complete_partial_deletion method addresses this issue as well.

Change-Id: I20ea77bd20f093ce1be7169c0647cdc7ff62117c
Closes-Bug: 1494653
(cherry picked from commit 4031272fe93d1046cff4c0cc788c8e78db944419)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary 'context' param from quotas reserve method call

'context' parameter was removed from quota-related method signatures in patch [1].
In patch [2] use of 'context' parameter was removed from quota-related method calls.

Still at some places 'context' parameter was passed to quota reserve method call.

Removed use of 'context' parameter from those places and passed 'context' as kwargs
while creating object of nova.objects.Quotas type.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164268/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/160499/

Backport notice:
On restart of nova-compute if there is instance with vm_state as
'DELETED' but that instance is not marked as deleted in database. In that case,
while calling _complete_partial_deletion method from _init_instance method
it raises " ValueError: Circular reference detected" error.

Removing 'context' parameter from quotas.reserve method call in
_complete_partial_deletion method addresses this issue as well.

Change-Id: I20ea77bd20f093ce1be7169c0647cdc7ff62117c
Closes-Bug: 1494653
(cherry picked from commit 4031272fe93d1046cff4c0cc788c8e78db944419)

added_lines: quotas = objects.Quotas(context=context) quotas = objects.Quotas(context=context) quotas = objects.Quotas(context=context)
deleted_lines: quotas = objects.Quotas(context) quotas = objects.Quotas(context) quotas = objects.Quotas(context)

commit_message:
Parametrize table_prefix_separator in hbase

table_prefix_separator is hardcoded to be an underscore (happybase
default). This fix adds the possibility to parametrize this value using
a parameter in ceilometer database configuration. An example is:
hbase://localhost:9090/?table_prefix=ceilo&table_prefix_separator=.

Change-Id: I8c3c2a0b35001991844e679282ffd0ee4ae76abc
Closes-Bug: #1331374
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/63/228363/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return '%s?table_prefix=%s&table_prefix_separator=%s' % ( os.getenv("CEILOMETER_TEST_HBASE_TABLE_PREFIX", "test"), os.getenv("CEILOMETER_TEST_HBASE_TABLE_PREFIX_SEPARATOR", "_")

commit_message:
Stop managing file modes

File modes should be managed by packaging, not by Puppet.
This patch aims to stop managing File { mode => } parameters.

Partial-bug: #1458915
Change-Id: Ic38317521ac4a91bfdf234ecb4c74e4b00e3d887

commit_message:
Fix swift.conf / Swift_config ordering

This patch makes sure /etc/swift/swift.conf is created *before* trying
to configure Swift with Swift_config provider.

Change-Id: Ic470e11fae73e36cde67e1168aeab06773e3d974

commit_message:
Allow to not manage Keystone domain

When configuring Heat domains, we might want to use the default domain.
However, the default domain might already exist or managed by
puppet-keystone.
This patch allows to disable its management in puppet-heat, but keep
True for backward compatibility so the domain will be managed by
default.

Change-Id: I2e9f2ebb5b12cc33565d74bf955250dcc82bcbb9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat refs/changes/36/227936/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'when not managing the domain creation' do before do params.merge!( :manage_domain => false ) end it { is_expected.to_not contain_keystone_domain('heat_domain') } end

Use Cinder API v1 for Rally tests

Rally doesn't support Cinder API v2 now so we need to enable v1 API.

commit_message:
Prepare for functional testing

Prepare for functional testing by creating two new directories:
  * ironic/tests/unit
  * ironic/tests/functional

Move all files currently in ironic/tests/* to ironic/tests/unit/

Update imports from 'ironic.tests.YYY' to 'ironic.tests.unit.YYY'

Fix any PEP8 issues due to longer lines

Partial-Bug: #1491670
Change-Id: I1166f20adf8c84b2042b62e348926502a4851e08

Partially-Implements: blueprint tosca-csar-translation

commit_message:
Add CSAR processing support

Add support for processing CSAR files and include necessary unit tests.

Note: Since CSAR files used do not already exist on github a temporary
URL has been used. Once the patch merges a follow-on patch will be
submitted to update the URL to a github URL.

Change-Id: Ibf44be1368ed0144ecf415068b0ca5aea5aa6134
Partially-Implements: blueprint tosca-csar-translation

commit_message:
scenario001: use Default as Keystone default domain

Do not try to use another domain name for default domain.
Let's validate our modules with default features and we will iterate
later with specific use cases.

Change-Id: Iaac6f0feb2ff3f8f35d1ee02309f3b3f01390e97

commit_message:
Add whitelist file support

A whitelist files allows the user to specify a list of regexes
that ostestr will expand and run. It is mutually exclusive with
blacklist, but not mutually exclusive with --regex/path.
The value of --regex/path is appended to the whitelist.

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic397212ef3127c176a5870676f67d8a5e0de0441

added_lines: list_files = parser.add_mutually_exclusive_group() list_files.add_argument('--blacklist_file', '-b', help='Path to a blacklist file, this file ' 'contains a separate regex exclude on each ' 'newline') list_files.add_argument('--whitelist_file', '-w', help='Path to a whitelist file, this file ' 'contains a separate regex on each newline.')def get_regex_from_whitelist_file(file_path): return '|'.join(open(file_path).read().splitlines()) def construct_regex(blacklist_file, whitelist_file, regex, print_exclude): if whitelist_file: exclude_regex += '|%s' % get_regex_from_whitelist_file(whitelist_file) exclude_regex = construct_regex(opts.blacklist_file, opts.whitelist_file, regex, opts.print_exclude)

commit_message:
Add opportunity to install muranoclient from change

Job gate-murano-devstack-dsvm used in openstack/python-muranoclient
repository for check that is no regressions after changing client
code.
But now this job installing muranoclient from Pypi repos and not using
code from review.
This patch add opportunity to check client code from review with this
job.

Change-Id: I4c4a1c27c89cb3da6c8cafa09f8773a78e666600

subject: Remove hack for sending gratuitous arp from fip ns
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-15 22:33:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c9e555944045bef638c90e13e1b801f7df14e77a', 'message': 'Remove hack for sending gratuitous arp from fip ns

I just saw this note toward bottom of the lartc [1] page:  "On Linux
2.4, you may need to execute 'echo 1 >
/proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_nonlocal_bind' before being able to send out
unsolicited ARP messages!"  I wonder if we set that in fip ns, if it
will let us send grat arp without adding/removing the IP.  It couldn't
be that easy, could it?

[1] http://lartc.org/howto/lartc.bridging.proxy-arp.html

Change-Id: Ie55b402a6c46af00c8d4875264489fc4318544b3
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-15 22:57:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ef82c0bf365fb1ec824d710cc6856eef38753ae5', 'message': 'Remove hack for sending gratuitous arp from fip ns

I just saw this note toward bottom of the lartc [1] page:  "On Linux
2.4, you may need to execute 'echo 1 >
/proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_nonlocal_bind' before being able to send out
unsolicited ARP messages!"  I wonder if we set that in fip ns, if it
will let us send grat arp without adding/removing the IP.  It couldn't
be that easy, could it?

commit_message:
Remove hack for sending gratuitous arp from fip ns

I just saw this note toward bottom of the lartc [1] page:  "On Linux
2.4, you may need to execute 'echo 1 >
/proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_nonlocal_bind' before being able to send out
unsolicited ARP messages!"  I wonder if we set that in fip ns, if it
will let us send grat arp without adding/removing the IP.  It couldn't
be that easy, could it?

[1] http://lartc.org/howto/lartc.bridging.proxy-arp.html

Change-Id: Ie55b402a6c46af00c8d4875264489fc4318544b3

commit_message:
Fix sorting behavior for common problematic fields

For some common fields (at this time, 'name') where we'd like the
field to be tokenized for searching, but would also like to sort the
values sensibly, there's no clear way to index the field as one type.
This patch mandates a not_analyzed subfield named 'raw' on any common
fields (regardless of how the name field itself is stored), and
intercepts sort terms on that field.

Change-Id: Ic7f76b887a7013c1126de87bc31f937c40c3b460
Closes-Bug: #1488236
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/78/226378/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'name': { 'type': 'string', 'index': 'not_analyzed', 'fields': { 'raw': {'type': 'string', 'index': 'not_analyzed'} } },

commit_message:
Support Heat Environments with the App Catalog.

This change enables schema support for Heat Environments in the
App Catalog. Since they are always YAML, it allows them to be added
in the asset.yaml file natively and leaves them as a YAML string
in the JSON file.

Change-Id: I400a3e6e5dbaec6ce6e1214af0d04962063d06c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/app-catalog refs/changes/29/228029/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: y = yaml.load(sys.stdin) for a in y['assets']: s = a['service'] if s['type'] == 'heat': if 'environment' in s: s['environment'] = yaml.dump(s['environment']) json.dump(y, sys.stdout)

commit_message:
Fix attempt to access not existed network group id key in input data

Code of NetworkGroupValidator.validate_network_group utilize 'id' key
(id of the network group being operated on) so its absence will
lead to KeyError exception when the data is not present in payload of the
request, e.g. when user updates certain attributes of the network group
using fuel-client. This patch fixes described problem.

Change-Id: Ida494738ce5d61a6eec20bfa815923c9da6a7d56
Closes-Bug: #1500308

commit_message:
Add additional facet fields

Adds terms to more field facets:
 OS::Nova::Server image ids, flavor ids, network names,
                  security group name, various networks fields
 OS::Glance::Image container_format, disk_format, tags,
                   visibility, protected, status
 OS::Designate::Zone status, type, action

Change-Id: I043d4d16482f3f10a53526d61ab0c425b077b88a
Implements: blueprint field-faceting

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-18 10:42:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/1aa3816a3f218c5602f8c38230df4a9e2537cbfe', 'message': 'Add tripleo.sh

tripleo.sh is a script to automate a TripleO setup. It's goals are to be
used in aiding:

- developer setups
- CI
- documentation generation (hopefully)

It's not a new CLI, or end user facing wrapper around existing TripleO
CLI's.

tripleo.sh should never contain any "business" logic in it that is
necessary for a successful deployment. It should instead just mirror the
steps that we document for TripleO end users.

commit_message:
Add tripleo.sh

tripleo.sh is a script to automate a TripleO setup. It's goals are to be
used in aiding:

- developer setups
- CI
- documentation generation (hopefully)

It's not a new CLI, or end user facing wrapper around existing TripleO
CLI's.

tripleo.sh should never contain any "business" logic in it that is
necessary for a successful deployment. It should instead just mirror the
steps that we document for TripleO end users.

Change-Id: I9396a487964955f59584965ecbfd4c88cca87c0e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/96/225096/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Copyright 2015 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. set -eu set -o pipefail SCRIPT_NAME=$(basename $0) function show_options () { echo "Usage: $SCRIPT_NAME [options]" echo echo "Automates TripleO setup steps." echo echo "Options:" echo " --repo-setup -- Perform repository setup." echo " --undercloud -- Install the undercloud." echo " -x -- enable tracing" echo " --help, -h -- Print this help message." echo exit $1 } TEMP=$(getopt -o ,h -l,help,repo-setup -o,x,h -n $SCRIPT_NAME -- "$@") if [ $? != 0 ] ; then echo "Terminating..." >&2 ; exit 1 ; fi # Note the quotes around `$TEMP': they are essential! eval set -- "$TEMP" DELOREAN_REPO_FILE=${DELOREAN_REPO_FILE:-"delorean.repo"} DELOREAN_REPO_URL=${DELOREAN_REPO_URL:-"http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/df/03/df0377d64e1ef0b53c4e78a8ff6a50159de5131a_733f1417"} RDO_RELEASE=${RDO_RELEASE:-kilo} REPO_SETUP= STDERR=/dev/null UNDERCLOUD_CONF=${UNDERCLOUD_CONF:-"/usr/share/instack-undercloud/undercloud.conf.sample"} while true ; do case "$1" in --repo-setup) REPO_SETUP="1"; shift 1;; -x) set -x; STDERR=/dev/stderr; shift 1;; -h | --help) show_options 0;; --) shift ; break ;; *) echo "Error: unsupported option $1." ; exit 1 ;; esac done function log { echo "#################" echo -n "$SCRIPT_NAME -- " echo $@ echo "#################" } function stackrc_check { OS_AUTH_URL=${OS_AUTH_URL:-""} if [ -z "$OS_AUTH_URL" ]; then echo "You must source a stackrc file for the Undercloud." exit 1 fi } function repo_setup { log "Performing repository setup..." # Enable RDO rpm -q rdo-release || sudo yum -y install http://rdo.fedorapeople.org/openstack-$RDO_RELEASE/rdo-release-$RDO_RELEASE.rpm # Enable last known good RDO Trunk Delorean repository sudo curl -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean.repo $DELOREAN_REPO_URL/$DELOREAN_REPO_FILE # Enable latest RDO Trunk Delorean repository sudo curl -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-current.repo http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/current/delorean.repo sudo sed -i 's/\[delorean\]/\[delorean-current\]/' /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-current.repo sudo /bin/bash -c "cat <<-EOF>>/etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-current.repo includepkgs=diskimage-builder,openstack-heat,instack,instack-undercloud,openstack-ironic,openstack-ironic-inspector,os-cloud-config,python-ironic-inspector-client,python-tripleoclient,tripleo-common,openstack-tripleo-heat-templates,openstack-tripleo-image-elements,openstack-tuskar-ui-extras,openstack-puppet-modules EOF" # Enable the Delorean Deps repository sudo curl -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-deps.repo http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/delorean-deps.repo # Install the yum-plugin-priorities package so that the Delorean repository # takes precedence over the main RDO repositories. sudo yum -y install yum-plugin-priorities log "Repository setup done." } function undercloud { sudo yum install -y python-tripleoclient cp -b -f $UNDERCLOUD_CONF ~/undercloud.conf openstack undercloud install } if [ "$REPO_SETUP" = 1 ]; then repo_setup fi

commit_message:
Make network-driver check based on COE type

Right now the network-driver check is not right, it bind to one type
without COE difference, difference COE may support different
network-drivers. So it is better to use dict check based on COE type.

Change-Id: I9db3482c9f83ef57a821133482117565578bedd3
Closes-Bug: #1500637

commit_message:
Changed the Diffie Hellman parameter maximum size

This introduces the variable haproxy_ssl_dh_param

It sets the maximum size of the DH parameters used
for generating key in DHE key exchange.

Higher values increase CPU load but is more secure.

This value is ignored if static DH params are given
in cert file.

Change-Id: Idca02a8337fa3790ddfb849d9e2e87d60076c399

commit_message:
Add new project renderspec to openstack-rpm-packaging channel

renderspec is a new tool that renders generic RPM .spec templates into
distribution specific .spec files to build packages from.

This way, we can share one package dist-git between different RPM
distributions.

Change-Id: I584f6d584b00238aab09227e3f4418478aaf36ea

commit_message:
Add new project pymod2pkg to openstack-rpm-packaging channel

pymod2pkg is a simple python module used to translate upstream python module
names to corresponding distribution package names.

Currently, RDO distros (CentOS/Fedora) and SUSE are supported.

Change-Id: Ib129e766c44adc302401618febc381468d7a27f9

commit_message:
Add username in openrc

Currently no matter if we source openrc, it could not seen in any
where but exec 'export'. Add the usename display by using PS1 shell
environment variable.

Change-Id: Ib990368ba2d1ac2a0a44467935b36d78b7ee567f

Adding docs for try, except, pass

Change-Id: Id290f43cf16557a02712cd09d58edf26ab8c6820
Partial-bug: #1474796
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bandit refs/changes/86/228386/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ===============Errors in Python code bases are typically communicated using ```Exceptions```. An exception object is 'raised' in the event of an error and can be 'caught' at a later point in the program, typically some error handling or logging action will then be performed. However, it is possible to catch an exception and silently ignore it. This is illustrated with the following example .. code-block:: python try: do_some_stuff() except Exception: pass This pattern is considered bad practice in general, but also represents a potential security issue. A larger than normal volume of errors from a service can indicate an attempt is being made to disrupt or interfere with it. Thus errors should, at the very least, be logged. There are rare situations where it is desirable to suppress errors, but this is typically done with specific exception types, rather than the base Exception class (or no type). To accommodate this the test may be configured to ignore try, except, pass where the exception is typed. For example, the following would not generatena warning if the configuration option '''checked_typed_exception''' is set to False: .. code-block:: python try: do_some_stuff() except ZeroDivisionError: pass - Bandit v0.13.0 check_typed_exception: True.. code-block:: none >> Issue: Try, Except, Pass detected. Severity: Low Confidence: High Location: ./examples/try_except_pass.py:4 3 a = 1 4 except: 5 pass- https://security.openstack.org

commit_message:
Create utility log dir and link when on metal

Currently, running os-tempest-install.yml fails when utility is on
metal.  This is due to the rsyslog-client role trying to access
/var/log/utility which isn't being created.  This commit updates
utility-install.yml by creating the necessary log dir in
/openstack/logs and drops the symlink to it in /var/log.

Change-Id: Ie0975478b0ba92f7acf656f6bf84cf3fd982151e
Closes-Bug: #1499214
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/69/227169/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Create log dir file: path: "{{ item.path }}" state: directory with_items: - { path: "/openstack/log/{{ inventory_hostname }}-utility" } when: is_metal | bool tags: - utility-logs - tempest-log-dirs - name: Create log aggregation links file: src: "{{ item.src }}" dest: "{{ item.dest }}" state: "{{ item.state }}" force: "yes" with_items: - { src: "/openstack/log/{{ inventory_hostname }}-utility", dest: "/var/log/utility", state: "link" } when: is_metal | bool tags: - utility-logs

commit_message:
Throttling bandwidth on Linux for HTTPS

using trickle to limit bandwidth on linux by allowing freezer agent
to run a fork of itself through trickle and passing limit parameters
(upload-limit, download-limit) to trickle and remove it from
freezer agent.

Closes-Bug: #1466858

Change-Id: I0c3ac2e4085389dc71c8e242c84fefe7aea3c8a5

commit_message:
Enable semi-spacing

This rule aims to enforce spacing around a semicolon. This rule
prevents the use of spaces before a semicolon in expressions.

http://eslint.org/docs/rules/semi-spacing

Change-Id: I20a123350ef923c7168c80fe56a9c3e5db0ff4a4

commit_message:
Pass kernel id and ramdisk id to S3 image service

Currently, when an image is registered in EC2 API, kernel and ramdisk
image properties that are specified during call to register_image are
not passed to S3 image service and the image is created without them.
This change fixes it.

Closes-bug: #1498005

Change-Id: I6a3855780e74c52821930a3f3c0589b0a468a8e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/29/226229/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: kernel_id = metadata['properties'].get('kernel_id') ramdisk_id = metadata['properties'].get('ramdisk_id') if kernel_id: metadata['properties']['kernel_id'] = kernel_id if ramdisk_id: metadata['properties']['ramdisk_id'] = ramdisk_id

subject: reuse the deleted image-member before create a new image-member
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-12 02:00:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/0824fa7173aa636b5456d036365b4b35e6768db8', 'message': "member-create should handle the previous deleted image-member

If an image-member is deleted, then create it again with the same parameters, glance searches db to see if there is already an existing one, but the result doesn't
include the record which was marked as deleted, glance will try to create a new one with the same parameters, it will fail with SQL0803N error. To fix this, we should
check all existing image-member records including the deleted image-member before create image-member, then update it if it exists, otherwise create a new one.

Fixes Bug: 1462315

Change-Id: I84f88d133bf4ac6daa0ff5d148aed86c0ff2cb2d

commit_message:
reuse the deleted image-member before create a new image-member

If glance backend database is not MySQL or postgreSQL,the unique
constraint of image-member only includes image-id and member.
If then an image-member is deleted, then create it again with the
same parameters, glance initiates a query to check if there is
already an existing one, but the result doesn't include the record
which was marked as deleted, glance will try to create a new one
with the same parameters, it will fail with SQL0803N error. To fix
this,we should check all existing image-member records including
the deleted image-member before create image-member, then update it
if it exists, otherwise create a new one.

APIImpact

Closes-Bug: #1462315
Implements: bp reuse-the-deleted-image-member

Change-Id: I84f88d133bf4ac6daa0ff5d148aed86c0ff2cb2d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/95/190895/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def image_member_find(context, image_id=None, member=None, status=None, include_deleted=False): members = _image_member_find(context, session, image_id, member, status, include_deleted) member=None, status=None, include_deleted=False): if not include_deleted: query = query.filter_by(deleted=False)
deleted_lines: def image_member_find(context, image_id=None, member=None, status=None): members = _image_member_find(context, session, image_id, member, status) member=None, status=None): query = query.filter_by(deleted=False)

subject: Security hardening for /etc/swift
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-02 21:32:45.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/swift_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift/commit/da4447bfb5dcd3e1f92fbcb74d49ee0246e4ff09', 'message': 'Security hardening for /etc/swift

This change locks down the permissions on the /etc/swift directory and
all files contained within this folder. In this change, we are setting
the owner on the /etc/swift folder and all files contained within the
directory to root while leaving the group set to swift. Additionally we
are removing group write permissions from the directories and files. We
are also setting the setgid flag to ensure that files manually created
get the correct default group membership.

This change applies the principles from the OpenStack security
documentation for object-storage in puppet form. See
http://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/object-storage.html for further
information.

Change-Id: I299ed46f41096812b0a885e94c59b666763d8f91
Closes-Bug: 1289631
'}]
commit_message:
Security hardening for /etc/swift

This change locks down the permissions on the /etc/swift directory and
all files contained within this folder. In this change, we are setting
the owner on the /etc/swift folder and all files contained within the
directory to root while leaving the group set to swift. Additionally we
are removing group write permissions from the directories and files. We
are also setting the setgid flag to ensure that files manually created
get the correct default group membership.

This change applies the principles from the OpenStack security
documentation for object-storage in puppet form. See
http://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/object-storage.html for further
information.

Change-Id: I299ed46f41096812b0a885e94c59b666763d8f91
Closes-Bug: 1289631
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/83/219883/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: File { owner => 'root', group => 'swift', require => Package['swift'] } # NOTE: we are intentionally setting 2640 on the /etc/swift directory with # recurse = true. See LP#1289631 for more details. file { '/etc/swift': ensure => directory, recurse => true, mode => '2640', owner => 'swift' owner => 'swift' mode => '0640',
deleted_lines: File { owner => 'swift', group => 'swift', require => Package['swift'] } file { '/etc/swift': ensure => directory, mode => '2770', mode => '0660',

commit_message:
Disable requirements liberty/master cross-check

Master requirements changes were tested with stable/liberty branches,
in addition to master branches, until a proper stable/liberty
requirements branch can be cut.

disable the cross-check jobs, now that the requirements stable branch
was cut.

commit_message:
Fix issues with the blacklist file regex generation

This commit fixes a couple of bugs in the blacklist file regex
generator. The first where a comment line was accidently made
mandatory. If a comment wasn't specified an IndexError would be
raised. The second was related to the variable naming in the
function's blacklist file if branch. Variable reuse there was causing
the last blacklist regex to take precendence over a regex passed
in and would be used instead.

Change-Id: Ib80a0c1781db7c8c9e4449b4773258fe3348411a
Closes-Bug: #1488700

commit_message:
rebuild: Apply migration context before calling the driver

In I0233f964d8f294f0ffd9edcb16b1aaf93486177f we made sure that we are
properly using the data stashed in the migration context for resource
tracking, however - we missed that we need to also apply it when passing
data to the driver to do the spawn (or rebuild if implemented).

This patch adds a context manager that helps us temporarily apply the
migration context to an instance object, as we want to make sure that we
don't save the new data before it's ready to be used by the resource
tracker.

Change-Id: I9a4b86e176f408c1495d5308d3e7041292c2625a
Closes-bug: #1499028

commit_message:
Volume enters error_deleting state when unmanage

Volume enters error_deleting state when unmanage in Gluster Driver.
Add unmanage function in GlusterfsDriver to solve the error_deleting volume
state.

Co-authored-by: wanghao <wanghao749@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I8fb50f01f209c37e48933c8fa92f54a265322c30
Closes-Bug: #1487329

Fix vboxmanage to run via execute decorator.

commit_message:
Catch InvalidURL when requesting store size

If location URL looks like scp address:
http://some_address:~/some_image then glance accepts this address
and creates a malformed image.
The problem here is because python http_client lib is trying to
recognize '~' as port but it is not acceptable port name.
The lib generates an InvalidURL exception but this exception is
hidden in one of universal catchers(except Exception).
We need to validate port name (is present before passing it to
http_client lib.

Change-Id: I36dddf7059711fb15ecb1fec4e438daf2bffcb60
Closes-bug: #1485792

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order of arguments in assertEqual.
The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Change-Id: I210ce20cb9427799219e8aedb9ee3282dea53d3f
Closes-Bug: #1259292

subject: Enable ovsdb native port only once per process
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-25 16:13:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/idlutils.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/ovsdb/test_impl_idl.py', 'neutron/agent/ovsdb/impl_idl.py', 'neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/connection.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/df7ca2a5e5f77d9f197ebc8f4f0a29e2e294461b', 'message': 'Enable ovsdb native port only once per process

Previously, we tried to enable the port each time API object was
created, which, as it turned out, done on every BaseOVS __init__ call.
It made agents to spend a lot of time calling to rootwrap for no
reason.

Now, do it just once when the first object of the type is created.

To be able to unit test the impl_idl module, made it possible to
import without ovs library being installed (the library is still
missing in unit test gate due to python 3.x issues, so we should
gracefully handle ImportError).

Closes-Bug: #1499784
Change-Id: I22670d52ec9897d9b4ff6e9d3189226adcb492d1
'}]
commit_message:
Enable ovsdb native port only once per process

Previously, we tried to enable the port each time API object was
created, which, as it turned out, done on every BaseOVS __init__ call.
It made agents to spend a lot of time calling to rootwrap for no
reason.

Now, do it just once when the first object of the type is created.

To be able to unit test the impl_idl module, made it possible to
import without ovs library being installed (the library is still
missing in unit test gate due to python 3.x issues, so we should
gracefully handle ImportError).

Closes-Bug: #1499784
Change-Id: I22670d52ec9897d9b4ff6e9d3189226adcb492d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/32/227932/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: from ovs.db import idl from ovs import poller except ImportError: # TODO(ihrachyshka) remove it once we have ovs library in unit test gate idl = poller = None
deleted_lines: from ovs.db import idl from ovs import poller

service restart.

commit_message:
introduce a common bug report utility

This spec proposes to introduce a command line utility which collects
the debug data we would like to have for a proper bug triage. The
artifact of an execution should then be enough to attach it to a bug
report. The turnaround time of bugs could be decreased.

The blueprint will live most likely in the oslo namespace.

Change-Id: I7bef1df17b948e15ee9d124771dd9e8099be31d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-specs refs/changes/36/227736/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ==================== OpenStack Bug Report ==================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/<new-repo-name>/+spec/openstack-bug-report The contributors need certain information from a bug report to do a proper bug triage and/or to have criteria if patches for this bug really solve the described issue. To provide this information in each bug report, the reporter has to collect them manually, although OpenStack is already aware of most of the information. The collecting of the information is cumbersome and sometimes the reporter doesn't exactly know what is needed, so it is often omitted in the reports. The turnaround time of bugs could be decreased if the reporter has a means to collect the debug information automatically. The artifact of an execution of this means should then contain enough information to attach it to a bug report. Problem description =================== Nova has right now around 1000 open bugs. Around 600 of them are not yet in progress. Many of them lack the necessary information to do a proper bug triage and/or to have criteria if patches for this bug really solve the issue. This includes the logs, the configuration options, the host environment and the steps which led to the bug report. Neutron and Cinder face the same issues. And most probably the other projects too. To provide debug information in each bug report, the reporter has to collect them manually, although OpenStack is already aware of most of the information. The bug triage could be made faster if we give the user a means to collect the necessary debug data in a somewhat automated way with as less interaction from the user as possible. This spec proposes to introduce a command line utility which collects the debug data we would like to have for a proper bug triage. The artifact of an execution should then be enough to attach it to a bug report. The turnaround time of bugs could be decreased. Proposed change =============== The overall vision I have can be done in stages: * stage 1 (short term): Execute a cmd utility on each node where you want to collect debug information. Expect zero input arguments from the user (but make it configurable). The user attaches the created artifact to a new bug report. * stage 2 (mid term): Enhance the collection data based on the experiences based on stage 1. * stage 3 (long term): Execute a utility on one node and collect the information from all necessary nodes (1 <= necessary nodes <= all nodes). The user attaches the created artifact to a new bug report. * stage 4 (future): Execute a utility on one node and collect the information from all necessary nodes. The bug report is created automatically with the attached artifact. The scope of this spec is **only stage 1** which should be feasible within one release cycle. From a user perspective it should behave like this: .. code-block:: bash $ ssh user@node1 $ openstack-bug-report $ ll 2015-07-30_11:05:06_openstack_bug_report.tar.gz $ tar -ztvf 2015-07-30_11:05:06_openstack_bug_report.tar.gz ./summary.log ./logs/n-cpu.log ./confs/nova.conf ./confs/cinder.conf ./confs/neutron.conf ./envs/host.log ./envs/pip_freeze.log ./envs/hypervisor.log # TBD what is considered necessary $ exit $ ssh user@node2 $ openstack-bug-report $ ll 2015-07-30_11:10:01_openstack_bug_report.tar.gz $ tar -ztvf 2015-07-30_11:10:01_openstack_bug_report.tar.gz ./summary.log ./logs/n-api.log ./logs/n-cpu.log ./confs/nova.conf ./confs/cinder.conf ./confs/neutron.conf ./envs/host.log ./envs/pip_freeze.log ./envs/hypervisor.log # TBD what is considered necessary We should use tools which are already available in the host operating system, for example for Linux distributions https://github.com/sosreport/sos and serve solely as a facade to these tools:: User + | |./openstack-bug-report | v +---------------+----------------+ | | | openstack-bug-report.py | | | +--------+---------------+-------+ | | | | | | +-----v------+ +-----v-----+ | sosreport | | tool XY | +------------+ +-----------+ This blueprint got initially proposed to `Nova <https://review.openstack.org/#/c/209847/>`_ where we discussed about the location. We came to the conclusion that it would make sense to start this in a new repository in the *oslo* namespace, something like *oslo.bugreport*. **Security Impact** This touches sensitive data, like * config options (passwords, IP addresses, database connection strings, ?) * information of the host system (operating system, installed packages, ?) * user data in the logs files Depending on the actual implementation it could be necessary to execute the feature as sudo. The OpenStack Security Group should definitely be involved in the reviews. Alternatives ------------ We could ask the bug reporters every time to do the collection with the tools they have at hand. The result of that will look different every time, I guess. Very few bug reports in Nova (that's where I can make a statement) contain the minimal information which is explicitly asked for when you open a new bug. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Markus Zoeller (markus_z) https://launchpad.net/~mzoeller Other contributors: None (but feel free to join!) Work Items ---------- * create the CLI utility as facade * make it pluggable to use different tools which are already available on the host operating system / distro (version) * create a summary of user actions which shows a high-level "steps to reproduce" * ensure that there is a way to mask sensitive data * make it configurable (e.g. collect only data from the last 10 min.) Testing ------- I don't think we would need tempest tests for that. I would assume that the bug-teams of the project should also be the people which say if the implementation is acceptable, because they will work with the result. Dependencies ============ None I'm currently aware of. I didn't have done a proof of concept yet which could have shown me what is needed. History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Mitaka - Introduced .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

commit_message:
Modify PRODUCTION substitution regexp

Sometimes astute.yaml is serialized with double quotes and
sometimes without. This patch is to make it possible to
substitue PRODUCTION value not depending on yaml serialization mode.

Change-Id: I171405edafad2989f4894a501841ff71df0a5bf5

commit_message:
fuelmenu: modify yaml serialization mode

This patch is to avoid using double quotes when
serializing astute.yaml

{"key": "value"} ->
key: value

commit_message:
Adds Hyper-V imagecache cleanup

At the moment the Hyper-V driver's imagecache only deals with caching
the images in _base.

This blueprint will deal with implementing imagecache management that will
allow the aging and deletion of cached images that are no longer in use.

Implements blueprint: hyper-v-imagecache-cleanup

Change-Id: Id23838615589683b44bf58e994587fdedcfb23bf

added_lines: def test_age_and_verify_cached_images(self): fake_images = [mock.sentinel.FAKE_IMG1, mock.sentinel.FAKE_IMG2] fake_used_images = [mock.sentinel.FAKE_IMG1] self.imagecache.originals = fake_images self.imagecache.used_images = fake_used_images self.imagecache._update_image_timestamp = mock.Mock() self.imagecache._remove_if_old_image = mock.Mock() self.imagecache._age_and_verify_cached_images( mock.sentinel.FAKE_CONTEXT, mock.sentinel.all_instances, mock.sentinel.FAKE_BASE_DIR) self.imagecache._update_image_timestamp.assert_called_once_with( mock.sentinel.FAKE_IMG1) self.imagecache._remove_if_old_image.assert_called_once_with( mock.sentinel.FAKE_IMG2) @mock.patch.object(imagecache.ImageCache, '_get_image_backing_files') def test_remove_if_old_image(self, mock_get_img_backing_file): fake_backing_files = {'base_file': [mock.sentinel.BACKING_FILE], 'resized_files': [mock.sentinel.RESIZED_FILE1, mock.sentinel.RESIZED_FILE2] } mock_get_img_backing_file.return_value = fake_backing_files self.imagecache._pathutils.get_age_of_file.return_value = 3600 self.imagecache._remove_if_old_image(mock.sentinel.FAKE_IMAGE_FILE) calls = [mock.call(mock.sentinel.BACKING_FILE), mock.call(mock.sentinel.RESIZED_FILE1), mock.call(mock.sentinel.RESIZED_FILE2)] self.imagecache._pathutils.get_age_of_file.assert_has_calls(calls)

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fixed utilsfactory typo

Removed '' from 'None'. max_version should be None or float, not a string.

commit_message:
Supports capabilities required by libnetwork

Supports the required rpc for specifying capabilities of
the plugin. Adds a new config option for the Scope capability:
https://github.com/docker/libnetwork/blob/master/docs/remote.md#set-capability

Change-Id: I46c3853718af496a6605fa7e27d32a7db719169a
Closes-Bug: #1499824
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr refs/changes/12/228212/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @app.route('/NetworkDriver.GetCapabilities', methods=['POST']) def plugin_scope(): capabilities = {'Scope': cfg.CONF.capability_scope} return flask.jsonify(capabilities)

commit_message:
Kill HEADS file

Now that we forbid branch points as part of check_migration, there is no
technical need in maintaining the file. It only slows down developers that are
forced to resolve git conflicts after every new migration merged.

We remove the file as part of new 'revision' generation.

Now that the file is not present, we introspect the alembic scripts to
determine whether the subproject uses split migrations (presense of a branch
point indicates that).

Change-Id: Ic1ae0c3fc70be859919b89444dbfdcb1068bb1cd

commit_message:
Add note for jumbo frames MTU configuration

Add a note that it is necessary to make sure that
the HW switch that the private interface is connected to
is configured with the correct MTU value. Otherwise
jumbo frames won't work

Change-Id: I428bfb9652aa277650458fed4c6dc41d8670d9d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/73/228873/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: Make sure that the appropriate MTU value is configured on the hardware switch that the private interface is connected to. Otherwise only standard frames (1528 bytes) will pass through.

commands that are part of the openstack Common Testing Interface

This macro is then used in a new job, that uses npm to build the
package from the repository. The `npm pack` command will run the
entire npm packaging lifecycle, before generating a tarball that
contains the assets configured in package.json's 'files' field.

This tarball is named using the version in package.json, which
isn't really helpful for a post gate job, so it is immediately
overwritten before the tarball is then uploaded to
static.openstack.org.

commit_message:
Added npm-publish-tarball

This adds an npm job that runs npm-pack, and then renames the
tarballs to match our versioning scheme before uploading them to
the tarball host.

The `npm pack` command commits the current project to the local
npm cache directory, which triggers a full lifecycle run (prepublish,
etc). This generates a tarball with all assets listed in the package's
"files" field, inside the npm cache. This tarball is then copied back
to the working directory.

Since the default naming is not helpful, the job then immediately
renames it before the tarballs are published, using our usual
version names.

This job is then used by ironic-webclient. Note that this commit
removes 'bare-precise' as a node option, because Ubuntu precise does
not package a recent enough version of nodejs for any of this.

Change-Id: Ifb7898f136fafae70b5b0cd2727cc478034667c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/53/212153/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add note for jumbo frames MTU configuration

Add a note that it is necessary to make sure that
the HW switch that the private interface is connected to
is configured with the correct MTU value. Otherwise

Add share capacity retriever method

This method is used by the Cinder Windows SMB driver.

Change-Id: Iba4380395eeb7f5007f67ba0111d9b536d8d4115

added_lines: import ctypesfrom os_win._i18n import _, _LEfrom os_win.utils import win32utils kernel32 = ctypes.windll.kernel32 self._win32_utils = win32utils.Win32Utils() def get_share_capacity_info(self, share_path, ignore_errors=False): norm_path = os.path.abspath(share_path) total_bytes = ctypes.c_ulonglong(0) free_bytes = ctypes.c_ulonglong(0) try: self._win32_utils.run_and_check_output( kernel32.GetDiskFreeSpaceExW, ctypes.c_wchar_p(norm_path), None, ctypes.pointer(total_bytes), ctypes.pointer(free_bytes)) return total_bytes.value, free_bytes.value except exceptions.Win32Exception as exc: LOG.error(_LE("Could not get share %(share_path)s capacity info. " "Exception: %(exc)s"), dict(share_path=share_path, exc=exc)) if ignore_errors: return 0, 0 else: raise exc

commit_message:
Use Win32 API for the copy method

At the moment, the PathUtils copy method is using exec calls.

This patch changes that, using the Win32API CopyFileW function.

Change-Id: I80de7ca60f95bcb2fa3a08e8401553c2508f594e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/60/227760/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._ctypes = mock.Mock() self._wintypes = mock.Mock() self._wintypes.BOOL = lambda x: (x, 'BOOL') self._ctypes.c_wchar_p = lambda x: (x, "c_wchar_p") wintypes=self._wintypes, ctypes=self._ctypes, kernel32=mock.DEFAULT, def test_copy(self): fail_if_exists = False self._pathutils.copy(mock.sentinel.src, mock.sentinel.dest, fail_if_exists=fail_if_exists) self._mock_run.assert_called_once_with( pathutils.kernel32.CopyFileW, self._ctypes.c_wchar_p(mock.sentinel.src), self._ctypes.c_wchar_p(mock.sentinel.dest), self._wintypes.BOOL(fail_if_exists), kernel32_lib_func=True) def test_copy_exc(self): self._mock_run.side_effect = exceptions.Win32Exception self.assertRaises(IOError, self._pathutils.copy, mock.sentinel.src, mock.sentinel.dest)

commit_message:
Add symlink related functions

This patch adds methods for creating symlinks and checking
whether a path is a symlink.

Those methods are used by the Cinder Windows SMB driver,
using symlinks as 'mount points'.

Change-Id: Ifbfbae858adda5f297111d41adbbfce176b6b607
