commit_message:
Adds group support to inventory-manage.py

Added -g for showing groups per instance and -G for showing instances
per group.

Also fixed up some pep8 and pylint issues.

Closes-Bug: 1482141

Change-Id: I698384467268336ecc74f865ee35f3e39cad5186
(cherry picked from commit d4d6b042dfb6cb98a73e103b55c12e92b47ed2a9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/66/228566/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## (c) 2015, Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net> # """Returns data about containers and groups in tabular formats.""" for filename in file_check: if os.path.isfile(filename): return filename """Remove items from a list. Keyword arguments: inventory -- inventory dictionary purge_list -- list of items to remove """ """Remove items from a dictionary. Keyword arguments: inventory -- inventory dictionary purge_list -- list of items to remove """ exclusive_action.add_argument( '-g', '--list-groups', help='List groups and containers in each group', action='store_true', default=False ) exclusive_action.add_argument( '-G', '--list-containers', help='List containers and their groups', action='store_true', default=False )def get_all_groups(inventory): """Retrieve all ansible groups. Keyword arguments: inventory -- inventory dictionary Will return a dictionary of containers as keys and corresponding groups as values. """ containers = {} for container_name in inventory['_meta']['hostvars'].keys(): # Skip the default group names since they're not helpful (like aio1). if '_' not in container_name: continue groups = get_groups_for_container(inventory, container_name) containers[container_name] = groups return containers def get_groups_for_container(inventory, container_name): """Return groups for a particular container. Keyword arguments: inventory -- inventory dictionary container_name -- name of a container to lookup Will return a list of groups that the container belongs to. """ # Beware, this dictionary comprehension requires Python 2.7, but we should # have this on openstack-ansible hosts already. groups = {k for (k, v) in inventory.items() if ('hosts' in v and container_name in v['hosts'])} return groups def get_containers_for_group(inventory, group): """Return containers that belong to a particular group. Keyword arguments: inventory -- inventory dictionary group -- group to use to lookup containers Will return a list of containers that belong to a group, or None if no containers match the group provided. """ if 'hosts' in inventory[group]: containers = inventory[group]['hosts'] else: containers = None return containers def print_groups_per_container(inventory): """Return a table of containers and the groups they belong to. Keyword arguments: inventory -- inventory dictionary """ containers = get_all_groups(inventory) required_list = [ 'container_name', 'groups' ] table = prettytable.PrettyTable(required_list) for container_name, groups in containers.iteritems(): row = [container_name, ', '.join(sorted(groups))] table.add_row(row) for tbl in table.align.keys(): table.align[tbl] = 'l' return table def print_containers_per_group(inventory): """Return a table of groups and the containers in each group. Keyword arguments: inventory -- inventory dictionary """ required_list = [ 'groups', 'container_name' ] table = prettytable.PrettyTable(required_list) for group_name in inventory.keys(): containers = get_containers_for_group(inventory, group_name) # Don't show a group if it has no containers if containers is None or len(containers) < 1: continue # Don't show default group if len(containers) == 1 and '_' not in containers[0]: continue # Join with newlines here to avoid having a horrific table with tons # of line wrapping. row = [group_name, '\n'.join(containers)] table.add_row(row) for tbl in table.align.keys(): table.align[tbl] = 'l' return table def print_inventory(inventory, sort_key): """Return a table of containers with detail about each. Keyword arguments: inventory -- inventory dictionary """ with open(environment_file, 'rb') as f_handle: inventory = json.loads(f_handle.read()) # Make a table with hosts in the left column and details about each in the # columns to the right # Groups in first column, containers in each group on the right elif user_args['list_groups'] is True: print(print_groups_per_container(inventory)) # Containers in the first column, groups for each container on the right elif user_args['list_containers'] is True: print(print_containers_per_group(inventory)) with open(environment_file, 'wb') as f_handle: f_handle.write(json.dumps(inventory, indent=2))
deleted_lines: for f in file_check: if os.path.isfile(f): return fdef print_inventory(inventory, sort_key): with open(environment_file, 'rb') as f: inventory = json.loads(f.read()) with open(environment_file, 'wb') as f: f.write(json.dumps(inventory, indent=2))

commit_message:
add jumbo frames feature

Add that the Neutron's jumbo frames feature
is automatically enabled during deployment

Closes-Bug:#1476651
Change-Id: I604666f8be2cbe5e2bb371276553837dd5cb9f2a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/20/207920/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: With the Neutron network selected, the jumbo frames feature will be automatically enabled during the deployment process. The jumbo frames parameters will be based on the node's private network interface's MTU value.

subject: Contains the directory name of /sys and /proc
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-20 10:36:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/4a6edabbafce5fa906960ae9bcdd7e458e05a92b', 'message': 'Contains the directory name of /sys and /proc when creating ramdisk for ironic python agent

When a ubuntu/IPA ramdisk is used to boot a baremetal machine with ironic agent-ilo driver, it fails at the point of mounting /proc and /sys.

Change-Id: Iad5d62f373b73789118f23db4c932ea6e9a784c3
Signed-off-by: Gary Duan <duanlg@live.cn>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-25 08:46:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/5885178d1225dafa63d4581c88560f312f25b7da', 'message': 'Contains the directory name of /sys and /proc

When a ubuntu/IPA ramdisk is used to boot a baremetal machine with
ironic agent-ilo driver, it fails at the point of mounting /proc
and /sys. After the vmlinuz(kernel) is started and it tries to
load the partitions on ramdisk. It need the directory of "/sys"
and "/proc" to mount the corresponding filesystems.

Change-Id: Iad5d62f373b73789118f23db4c932ea6e9a784c3
Signed-off-by: Gary Duan <duanlg@live.cn>
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-26 02:13:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/9f3be3e6ce59ad4a6ecae91c12efdfb62bb15c72', 'message': 'Contains the directory name of /sys and /proc

When a ubuntu/IPA ramdisk is used to boot a baremetal machine with
ironic agent-ilo driver, it fails at the point of mounting /proc
and /sys. After the vmlinuz(kernel) is started and it tries to
load the partitions on ramdisk. It need the directory of "/sys"
and "/proc" to mount the corresponding filesystems.

Closes-Bug: #1488445

commit_message:
Contains the directory name of /sys and /proc

When a ubuntu/IPA ramdisk is used to boot a baremetal machine with
ironic agent-ilo driver, it fails at the point of mounting /proc
and /sys. After the vmlinuz(kernel) is started and it tries to
load the partitions on ramdisk. It need the directory of "/sys"
and "/proc" to mount the corresponding filesystems.
In order to fix this issue, the directories of "sys" and "proc"
are retained but the subdirectories or files under them are empty.
With this change, the directories of "/sys" and "/proc" shows
up in the ramdisk and kernel will mount sys and proc filesystems
on them respectively.

Closes-Bug: #1488445
Change-Id: Iad5d62f373b73789118f23db4c932ea6e9a784c3
Signed-off-by: Gary Duan <duanlg@live.cn>

commit_message:
Switch VHDUtils to using virtdisk.dll

This patch refactors the vhdutils class in order to use virtdisk.dll.
Note that Windows Server 2012 or later is required.

The WMI Image Management Services classes previously used require
the Hyper-V role to be enabled.

The validate_vhd method has been removed as it was not used. At the
moment, the validation is performed when the disk image is opened.

The merge_vhd parent_vhd_path parameter has been removed as in our
use cases, we were always merging into the immediate next parent
image, thus making this operation more efficient.

Partially Implements: blueprint deprecate-virtualization-v1

Change-Id: I86b002e300b27c481967b9f0c4ee69d5adde3125

commit_message:
Fix variable name clash in construct_regex

construct_regex has both a local variable 'regex' and
a parameter to the methd by the same name. This results
in a bad regex returned from construct_regex.

Change-Id: I77d47f0cd100d908fcbdefb07cb74ecdf822c847

If a ' 'blacklist file is specified, these regex(es) ' 'will be appended to the end of the generated' 'regex(es) from that file.')def construct_regex(whitelist_file, blacklist_file, regex_option, print_exclude): test_regexp = exclude_regex if regex_option: test_regexp += regex_option if whitelist_file: white_file = open(whitelist_file, 'r') include_regex = '' for line in white_file: raw_line = line.strip() split_line = raw_line.split('#') # Before the # is the regex regex = split_line[0].strip() if regex: if include_regex: include_regex = '|'.join([regex, include_regex]) else: include_regex = regex if include_regex: include_regex = "(" + include_regex + ")" if test_regexp: test_regexp = '|'.join([test_regexp, include_regex]) else: test_regexp = include_regex return test_regexp exclude_regex = construct_regex(opts.whitelist_file, opts.blacklist_file, regex_option,

commit_message:
Introduce HTTP Proxy to WSGI middleware

This middleware is supposed to be placed in front of any WSGI
application. It will translate the WSGI environment to an environment
mimicking the environment of the reverse proxy placed in front of it.

It supports translating:
- Protocol via X-Forwarded-Proto
- Host via X-Forwarded-Host
- Prefix via X-Forwarded-Prefix (not standard, but already used in other
  projects)
- Forwarded header (RFC7239)

Change-Id: I9e66e17a343fc454016415375bcd5a1285334f5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.middleware refs/changes/68/227868/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from wsgiref import util from oslotest import base as test_base import webob from oslo_middleware import http_proxy_to_wsgi class TestHTTPProxyToWSGI(test_base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestHTTPProxyToWSGI, self).setUp() @webob.dec.wsgify() def fake_app(req): return util.application_uri(req.environ) self.middleware = http_proxy_to_wsgi.HTTPProxyToWSGIMiddleware( fake_app) self.request = webob.Request.blank('/foo/bar', method='POST') def test_no_headers(self): response = self.request.get_response(self.middleware) self.assertEqual("http://localhost:80/", response.body) def test_url_translate_ssl(self): self.request.headers['X-Forwarded-Proto'] = "https" response = self.request.get_response(self.middleware) self.assertEqual("https://localhost:80/", response.body) def test_url_translate_ssl_port(self): self.request.headers['X-Forwarded-Proto'] = "https" self.request.headers['X-Forwarded-Host'] = "example.com:123" response = self.request.get_response(self.middleware) self.assertEqual("https://example.com:123/", response.body) def test_url_translate_host_ipv6(self): self.request.headers['X-Forwarded-Proto'] = "https" self.request.headers['X-Forwarded-Host'] = "[f00:b4d::1]:123" response = self.request.get_response(self.middleware) self.assertEqual("https://[f00:b4d::1]:123/", response.body) def test_url_translate_base(self): self.request.headers['X-Forwarded-BaseURL'] = "/bla" response = self.request.get_response(self.middleware) self.assertEqual("http://localhost:80/bla", response.body) def test_url_translate_port_and_base_and_proto_and_host(self): self.request.headers['X-Forwarded-Proto'] = "https" self.request.headers['X-Forwarded-BaseURL'] = "/bla" self.request.headers['X-Forwarded-Host'] = "example.com:8043" response = self.request.get_response(self.middleware) self.assertEqual("https://example.com:8043/bla", response.body) def test_rfc7239_invalid(self): self.request.headers['Forwarded'] = ( "iam=anattacker;metoo, I will crash you!!P;m,xx") response = self.request.get_response(self.middleware) self.assertEqual("http://localhost:80/", response.body) def test_rfc7239_proto(self): self.request.headers['Forwarded'] = ( "for=foobar;proto=https, for=foobaz;proto=http") response = self.request.get_response(self.middleware) self.assertEqual("https://localhost:80/", response.body) def test_rfc7239_proto_host(self): self.request.headers['Forwarded'] = ( "for=foobar;proto=https;host=example.com, for=foobaz;proto=http") response = self.request.get_response(self.middleware) self.assertEqual("https://example.com/", response.body) def test_rfc7239_proto_host_base(self): self.request.headers['Forwarded'] = ( "for=foobar;proto=https;host=example.com:8043, for=foobaz") self.request.headers['X-Forwarded-BaseURL'] = "/bla" response = self.request.get_response(self.middleware) self.assertEqual("https://example.com:8043/bla", response.body)

commit_message:
Configure ceilometer to listen for snmpd

This patch updates Ceilometer so that we configure it
to listen for snmp agents for overcloud machines
that are created.

The patch also removes the snmpd client configuration
for the local instack node since this is only intended
to be running on overcloud instances (not the undercloud
itself).

Change-Id: Ieb4ebff67b7937d585c9a9adde9e336e37bb6eca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/92/226892/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO: add support for setting these to puppet-ceilometer ceilometer_config { 'hardware/readonly_user_name': value => hiera('snmpd_readonly_user_name'); 'hardware/readonly_user_password': value => hiera('snmpd_readonly_user_password'); }
deleted_lines: $snmpd_user = hiera('snmpd_readonly_user_name') snmp::snmpv3_user { $snmpd_user: authtype => 'MD5', authpass => hiera('snmpd_readonly_user_password'), } class { 'snmp': agentaddress => ['udp:161','udp6:[::1]:161'], snmpd_config => [ join(['rouser ', hiera('snmpd_readonly_user_name')]), 'proc cron', 'includeAllDisks 10%', 'master agentx', 'trapsink localhost public', 'iquerySecName internalUser', 'rouser internalUser', 'defaultMonitors yes', 'linkUpDownNotifications yes' ], }

Fix the home-page in setup.cfg with Oslo wiki page

The current value is launchpad url which is not
appropriate and so changed to Oslo wikipage

commit_message:
Change inspector iPXE config to use IPA

There is no longer an upstream inspector ramdisk, so we
need to switch to using IPA.

Depends-On: I73d39aca2410f0c2e5ead8e1b59d57af053bade7
Change-Id: Icfb443b54ecc224f5c68c76d0cd171b2f7adaf81
Closes-Bug: 1498068
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/31/225931/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: kernel http://{{local-ip}}:8088/agent.kernel ipa-inspection-callback-url=http://{{local-ip}}:5050/v1/continue initrd http://{{local-ip}}:8088/agent.ramdisk

commit_message:
enable cinder v1 for rally jobs

cinder v1 API is disable from Mitaka by default, but rally can't give up
those users right now.

Change-Id: I806c542ea275f45e7ef1fa0f3cae4b98e8877ca6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/52/228852/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - shell: | #/bin/bash -xe export CINDER_ENABLE_V1_API=True

commit_message:
Add logging for apache

* Add rsyslog logging to apache
* Store different apache vhosts logs separately
* Store apache logs on master

Change-Id: I4e75fff92fe39d6ccd19c47f479075459c6e8654
